pageContext.claim: “Today, it can take 10 years and far more than that just to get the approvals and permits needed to build a major infrastructure project.”
pageContext.analysis: The most complex, expensive and high-profile federal infrastructure projects require detailed, comprehensive environmental-impact statement under the National Environmental Policy Act of 1970. But such projects are a small portion of all public infrastructure projects. In fact, 95 percent of projects are excluded from environmental reviews required by law, according to the Government Accountability Office.
